name: Caramel Rolls
author: HungerGames12
summary: This is my absolute favorite thing on earth! It's perfect for all holiday mornings!
ingredients: 1 ½ tablespoons nonfat dry milk powder
directions: Combine water, 2 tablespoons butter, bread flour, white sugar, milk powder, and yeast, in that order, in the bucket of a bread machine
Remove dough from the machine after the cycle is done, about 1 hour 45 minutes
Combine brown sugar, light corn syrup, and 1/4 cup butter in a saucepan over medium heat
Cook and stir until sugar is dissolved, about 3 minutes
Pour sauce into an 8-inch square baking pan
Turn dough out onto a floured surface, punch it down, and roll into an 8x12-inch rectangle
Dot with 1/4 cup butter and sprinkle with cinnamon
Roll up and pinch seams together
Slice roll into 1 1/2-inch thick slices; place slices into the pan on top of the sauce
Set aside until doubled in size, about 1 hour
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Bake rolls in the preheated oven until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes
Cool in the pan for no more than 3 minutes; place a sheet of waxed paper on top of the pan and invert so that sauce and pecans are on top
